intro: Zigadenus falcatus, commonly known as death camis, is a toxic plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, arrowhead-shaped leaves and pale yellow flowers. The plant contains potent cardiotoxic alkaloids, making it highly dangerous to humans and animals. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. Due to its toxicity, it is often mistaken for edible plants, leading to accidental poisoning.
